brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts the concepts of throughput and goodput using a source node and a destination node, each with an O S I model next to it. As data moves from the source node to the destination node, throughput is represented as bits along the Physical Layer. Goodput is data that arrives at the Application Layer.

Data throughput is actual network performance. Goodput is a measure of the transfer of usable data after protocol overhead traffic has been removed.
